1. (Heads or Tails) Suppose 6 \emph{fair} coins are tossed and the outcome (head or tail) is recorded for each.  
   
a. The sample space $S$ corresponding to this "experiment" consists of all possible sequences of heads and tails that result from tossing 6 coins. How many elements are in $S$? Calculate the answer in a code chunk, save it to a variable called `num_S` and then print the value.  
   
b. Let $E$ denote the event that there are more heads than tails. How many elements are in $E$? Calculate this number in a code chunk, save your answer in a variable called `num_E` and print the value.  

   
c. What is $P(E)$? Calculate it in a code chunk and save it to variable called `prob_E` and print the value. Be sure to cite any rules you are using to make your theoretical probability calculation.

b. The event $E$ contains all the samples which have 5 tagged and 15 untagged fish. How many elements are in the event $E$? Leave your answer in terms of $N$.
